intro: Eustegia lonchitis, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually oval to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the spurge family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks. Eustegia lonchitis is known for its milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested.
